law.catch_line: The Comptroller shall assess a penalty not exceeding $500 if:...

text.section:
The Comptroller shall assess a penalty not exceeding $500 if:
an individual, as defined under § 10-101 of this article, files what purports to be an income tax return, but which:
does not contain information on which the substantial correctness of the tax may be determined; or
contains information that, on its face, indicates the tax reported on the return is substantially incorrect; and
the conduct of the individual is due to:
a desire, apparent on the face of the return, to delay or impede the administration of the provisions of Title 10 of this article; or
a position that is frivolous because the position:
has no basis in law or fact;
is patently unlawful; and
does not involve a legitimate dispute or reflect an inadvertent mathematical or clerical error.
The penalty under subsection (a) of this section is in addition to any penalty assessed under § 13-701 of this subtitle.
